admin.auditLog.info: Audit logs provide a record of changes and usage that help keep your organization secure and protect against misuse. Send data to a SIEM tool, watch for potential security issues, or build custom apps for better insight into how your company uses DatoCMS. Read the docs »

admin.blocksLibrary.overviewPage.descrip:
Blocks are dynamic, flexible and repeatable structures that you can embed inside your records in different ways. Quotes, sliders, call-to-actions... these are all great examples of blocks!

You can intersperse text and blocks with the Structured Text field, or give content creators the freedom to compose the layout for any page design by combining blocks in a Modular Content field.

Blocks don't count towards your plan records limit, and as soon as you delete a record, any embedded block gets deleted as well, leaving no orphaned structures around.

Read more about Blocks
admin.blocksLibrary.overviewPage.title: Blocks Library

admin.itemTypes.overviewPage.description:
Models are how you define the type of content your editors can store. Models work like a stencil, defining the structure of records which can be created within a project.

You can specify a number of different models: for example, a site can define different models for articles, products, categories, and so on.

Each model is composition of custom fields. You can also group fields into logical sets within the editing interface with fieldsets.

Read more about Models

admin.whiteLabelSettings.instructions:
Here you can specify a template URL that will be used to download custom I18n messages JSONs. The template must contain the :locale placeholder.

Here's an example of the JSON structure expected:

{
  "items.form.<MODEL_API_KEY>.name": "...",
  "items.form.<MODEL_API_KEY>.fields.<FIELD_API_KEY>.label": "...",
  "items.form.<MODEL_API_KEY>.fields.<FIELD_API_KEY>.hint": "...",
  "items.form.<MODEL_API_KEY>.fieldsets.<FIELDSET_TITLE>.title": "...",
  "items.form.<MODEL_API_KEY>.fieldsets.<FIELDSET_TITLE>.hint": "...",
  "menuItems.<MENU_ITEM_LABEL>.label": "...",
  "locales.<LOCALE_CODE>.label": "...",
}
admin.whiteLabelSettings.title: White-label settings
admin.whiteLabelSettings.update.success: Settings successfully saved, please reload the page to see the changes applied!
admin.workflow.enableTry.ok: Ok, let me play with Workflows!
admin.workflow.enableTry.question: Workflows is a feature enabled only for Enterprise customers. If you enable Workflows in playground mode, you will be able to create and configure workflows to see if they solve your needs, but you won't be able to actually associate them with any model. For that you'll need to contact Sales. Do you want to proceed?
admin.workflow.enableTry.title: Enable Workflows in playground mode?
admin.workflow.info: Workflows allow your team to explicitly define an editorial state machine to bring your draft content up to the final publication through a series of intermediate, fully customizable approval steps. Read the docs »
admin.workflow.transitions: Each role can specify which actions are allowed on a record at any particular stage, and to which stages a record can be moved. You can configure these settings by accessing the {link} area.

globalError.DEACTIVATED_SITE.body: Sorry but due to invoicing problems this project has been temporarly deactivated. Please contact your administrators to solve the issue.
globalError.DEACTIVATED_SITE.title: Project deactivated!
globalError.INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS.bod:
Sorry, but the action you're trying to perform requires some privileges you don't have.

If you think that's a mistake, you can always contact us via our Support form.
globalError.INVALID_SITE.body:
Sorry, but no DatoCMS project exists under this domain.

If you think this is an error, please contact us via our Support form.
globalError.INVALID_SITE.title: This project doesn't exist!
globalError.NOT_FOUND.body:
Sorry but some of the resources you requested do not exist.

If you think that's a mistake, you can always contact us via our Support form.
globalError.NOT_FOUND.title: Resource not found (404)
globalError.UNDER_MAINTENANCE.body:
Sorry for the inconvenience but we're performing some maintenance at the moment.

You always can check our Status page to follow progress or contact us on Support form.
globalError.UNDER_MAINTENANCE.title: We'll be back soon!
We're very sorry, but it seems that you've just found a bug. We've already been notified about this issue, and we'll work on it as soon as possibile.

If you want more info, you can always contact us via our Support page.

instructions.deployment: The job of building and deploying your static website is not performed directly by DatoCMS, but is delegated to an external Continuous Deployment service. Read more in our docs.
instructions.logs:
Here you can monitor in real-time the status of the communication between DatoCMS and your Continuous Deployment.

If something goes wrong during the publishing process, this is the first place to look for hints.
instructions.plugins: Plugins are custom webapps that expand the regular interface of DatoCMS. Read how to develop and share plugins with the community in our docs!

messages.confirm.copyFromMainLocale.ques: Do you want to copy the content currently present in {sourceLocale} into the new {destinationLocale} locale?
messages.confirm.copyFromMainLocaleMulti: Do you want to copy the content currently present in {sourceLocale} into the new locales ({destinationLocales})?

messages.confirm.deleteScheduledPublicat: This record will no longer be automatically published. Do you want to proceed?
messages.confirm.deleteScheduledUnpublis: This record will no longer be automatically unpublished. Do you want to proceed?
messages.confirm.delocalizeFieldAllLocal:
By disabling localization you will
    delete ALL content associated with these languages: {locales}.
    This field values will default to the main language content: {mainLocale}.
    Are you sure you want to proceed?
messages.confirm.delocalizeFieldNotAllLo:
By disabling localization this field
    values will default to the first language present on the record.
    The content associated with the other languages will be deleted.
    Site languages are currently sorted like this: {locales}.
    Are you sure you want to proceed?
messages.confirm.changeOrderingTreeSorta: By changings the records collection ordering, you will lose ALL information related to record positioning and parent/siblings relations. This information cannot be recovered. Are you sure you want to proceed?

messages.confirm.destroyEnvironment.ques: By deleting this environment you will permanently delete all of its content (models, records, plugins, uploads). Are you sure you want to proceed?

planUpgradeRequired.access_tokens.descri: You've reached the maximum number of API tokens your plan allows to create. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.blocks_depth.descrip: You've reached the maximum depth for blocks your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.blocks_per_item.desc: You've reached the maximum number of blocks per record your plan allows to create. If you're the project owner, please contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.build_triggers.descr: You've reached the maximum number of build triggers your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.item_types.descripti: You've reached the maximum number of models your plan allows to create. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.items.description: You've reached the maximum number of records your plan allows to create. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.locales.description: You've reached the maximum number of locales your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.maximum_single_uploa: You've uploaded a file that is bigger than the maximum single upload size your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please contact our support team.
planUpgradeRequired.mux_encoding_seconds: You've reached the maximum video encoding limits of your plan. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.otp.description: Two-factor authentication cannot be on the current plan. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.plugins.description: You've reached the maximum number of plugins your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.roles.description: You've reached the maximum number of roles your plan allows to create. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.sandbox_environments: You've reached the maximum number of environments your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.uploadable_bytes.des: You've reached the file storage limits of your plan. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.users.description: You've reached the maximum number of collaborators your plan allows to invite to the project. If you're the project owner, please head over to your account dashboard to upgrade the plan or, if no publicly available plan suits your needs, contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.webhooks.description: You've reached the maximum number of active webhooks your plan allows to have. If you're the project owner, please contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.workflow_stages.desc: You've reached the maximum number of stages per workflow your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.workflows.descriptio: Workflows is a feature that can only be enabled in Enterprise plans. If you're the project owner, please contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!
planUpgradeRequired.workflows_count.desc: You've reached the maximum number of workflows your plan allows. If you're the project owner, please contact our Sales team to get a custom quote!

travis.triggerDescription1: Follow this guide to obtain your API token, then paste it here:
travis.webhookDescription: Add the following lines to your .travis.yml config file:
unaccessiblePage.subtitle: This page contains unaccessible data
unaccessiblePage.title: Unaccessible data
upload.batchAddTags.hint: Please specify the tags to add to the selected assets:
upload.categorization.hint: Organize your assets with labels and notes to make them easier for your team to find.
upload.creator.title: Creator
upload.defaultFieldMetadata.hint: When you reference this asset inside a record without providing any specific metadata, these values will be used as a fallback.
upload.defaultFieldMetadata.title: Default metadata
uploadTable.author: Author
usageCounter.info:
Reports are updated every minute and can help you to better identify the source of the incoming requests. Theyâ€™re not to be considered 100%
    accurate, and serve for qualitative analysis.
usageCounter.video.info:
Reports are updated daily at 2:00 PM UTC and can help you to better identify the source of the incoming requests. Theyâ€™re not to be considered 100%
    accurate, and serve for qualitative analysis.
validator.date_range.hint: Specify an early and/or latest allowed date for this field
validator.date_range.title: Accept only specified date range
validator.date_time_range.hint: Specify an early and/or latest allowed date time for this field
validator.date_time_range.title: Accept only specified date time range
validator.description_length.hint: Specify a minimum and/or maximum allowed number of characters for description
validator.description_length.title: Limit description character count
validator.enum.hint: You won't be able to save or publish a record if the field value is not in the list of specified values
validator.enum.title: Accept only specified values
validator.extension.hint: You won't be able to save or publish a record if the file doesn't end with one the specified values
validator.extension.title: Accept only specified extensions
validator.file_size.hint: Specify a minimum and/or maximum allowed file size
validator.file_size.title: Accept only specified file size
validator.format.hint: Make this field match a pattern: e-mail address, URI, or a custom regular expression
validator.format.title: Match a specific pattern
validator.image_dimensions.hint: Specify a minimum and/or maximum width and height for images
validator.image_dimensions.title: Accept only specified image dimensions
validator.item_item_type.hint:
Make this field only accept records from specified model(s)
Read more about Link fields in our docs
validator.item_item_type.title: Accept only specified model
validator.items_item_type.title: Accept only specified models
validator.length.hint: Specify a minimum and/or maximum allowed number of characters
validator.length.title: Limit character count
validator.links.items_item_type.hint:
Make this field only accept records from specified model(s)
Read more about Link fields in our docs
validator.links.items_item_type.title: Accept only specified model
validator.number_range.hint: Specify a minimum and/or maximum value
validator.number_range.title: Range
validator.required.hint: You won't be able to save or publish a record if this field is empty
validator.required.title: Required
validator.required_alt_title.hint: Specify which image metadata has to be present - works only with image type uploads
validator.required_alt_title.title: Require alt and/or title
validator.required_seo_fields.hint: Specify which meta information has to be present
validator.required_seo_fields.title: Required
validator.rich_text_blocks.hint: The idea behind this field is to give your editors the choice to compose their content by alternating an arbitrary number of blocks from your Blocks Library. Authors will be able to choose, populate and reorder these blocks as needed. Read more in our docs
validator.rich_text_blocks.title: Specify the allowed blocks for this field
validator.size.hint: Specify a minimum and/or maximum allowed number of records
validator.size.title: Accept only a specified number of records
validator.slug_format.hint: Make this field match a pattern: webpage or a custom regular expression
validator.slug_format.title: Match a specific pattern
validator.slug_title_field.hint: Field from which it will be automatically generated a slug, unless manually specified
validator.slug_title_field.title: Reference field
validator.structured_text_blocks.hint: Structured text allows your editors to compose their content with a visual text editor which allows to choose, populate and reorder these blocks as needed. Read more in our docs
validator.structured_text_blocks.title: Specify the blocks allowed in this field
validator.structured_text_links.hint: Make this field accept links and inline records from specified model(s)
validator.structured_text_links.title: Allow links and inline records for these models
validator.title_length.hint: Specify a minimum and/or maximum allowed number of characters for title
validator.title_length.title: Limit title character count
validator.unique.hint: You won't be able to save or publish a record if there is an existing record with identical content
validator.unique.title: Unique field
validators.enum.hint: Separate each value with a comma. Use backslash () character to escape the comma.
validators.extension.hint: Separate each value with a comma (match is case insensitive)
validators.size.multipleOf: The number of records must also be multiple of
versions.restore.disabled: You cannot rollback right now as someone is editing this record
versions.restore.disabledCurrentVersion: You cannot rollback as this is already the latest version
versions.restore.disabledDueToPermission: You don't have enough permissions to rollback this record
versions.restore.title: Restore this version?
versions.title: Record history
videoInput.hint: Copy and paste the address of the page containing a YouTube, Vimeo or Facebook video here:
workflow.id.hint: It is generated automatically based on the name and will appear in the API responses
workflow.initialStage.hint: New records will be assigned to this stage
workflow.name: Name
workflow.stage.name: Name
workflow.used: {count, plural, =0 {Not used in any model} one {Used in one model} other {Used in {count} models} }
workflows.noWorkflows.description: Through workflows it is possible to set up a precise state machine able to bring a draft content up to the final publication (and beyond), through a series of intermediate, fully customizable approval steps.
workflows.noWorkflows.title: No workflows created!
wysiwygEditor.toolbar.hint: Configure which formatting options will be provided to editors
zeitSettings.branch:
Vercel will create a new deployment hook using the selected branch,
    be sure that your Vercel project is linked to a repository before going further.
    If the specified branch does not exist or it is deleted you will have to create a new DatoCMS build trigger.
zeitSettings.branch.hint: Specify the name of the branch (master, staging..) here
zeitSettings.changeLink: Want to link to a different Vercel project?
zeitSettings.integrationStart: Click the button to sign in to your Vercel account and start the integration!
zeitSettings.noLink: This DatoCMS project is currently linked to this Vercel project:
zeitSettings.noProjects: The Vercel account you selected does not have any projects!
zeitSettings.projectCreated: I've created a new project, refresh the list
zeitSettings.projectSelect: Select the Vercel project you want to link to this DatoCMS project:
